job.title: Software Engineer (Entry Level)
job.description: Launcher is developing the world’s most efficient rocket to deliver small satellites to orbit. We are now headquartered in Hawthorne, California (map). Please visit our careers page to learn more about Launcher's strategy and benefits. The Role: Support ongoing propulsion testing and advance the development of our Avionics software platform for our products: Launcher Engine-2, Launcher Orbiter, and Launcher Light. Compensation: Above average salary + company equity (stock options) + competitive benefits Start date: September 1, 2021, or earlier. Location: Hawthorne, CA The Following Software Development Roles Are Available Flight computer role - Required skills: C, C++, Linux Kernel, TCP/IP, Embedded Systems. Ground system platform role - Required skills: Web development including Node.JS, InfluxDB, Redis, HTML/CSS, Websocket, Amazon Web Services, Networking. Testing software role - Required skills: National Instruments DAQs, Labview, Python or C++, TCP/IP, able to read hardware datasheets and schematics. Minimum Requirements Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, or other engineering with strong software engineering experience or electives. Please specify your area of expertise and specific role interest in your cover letter. Please submit an engineering portfolio with relevant projects for the role. ITAR Requirement As we must adhere to the U.S. Government space technology export regulations, including the International Traffic in Arms Regulations, you must be a U.S. citizen, lawful permanent resident of the U.S., protected individual as defined by 8 U.S.C. 1324b(a)(3), or eligible to obtain the required authorizations from the U.S. Department of State. All applicants must indicate their immigration status on their resume and/or cover letter. Equal Opportunity Launcher is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin/ethnicity, veteran status, disability status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, mental or physical disability or any other legally protected status.
